intro: Oenanthe filicaulis, commonly known as the broad-leaved water dropwort, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage and small, white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist environments such as wet meadows and stream banks. Its leaves are broad and heart-shaped, while its stems are hollow and often have a mild, peppery scent. Oenanthe filicaulis is often found in temperate regions and is considered a herbaceous perennial.
